p: Trifluridine on the other hand is a synthetic pyrimidine nucleoside that is frequently used for the treatment of herpetic keratitis as a topical formulation. This drug was approved by the FDA in 1980 for its use as a 1% solution treatment for HSV-related keratitis and is at present one of the most common used topical antiviral for this type of affection in the United States ( Chou and Hong, 2014), with considerable effectivity reported ( Wilhelmus, 2015). However, local side effects have been described, some particularly severe. Table 1 summarizes the antiviral activity of these compounds.
